    1. Introduction

    • Historical flowmapping programs State of the art

    Tobler (1979), The Flowmapper etc.

    2. Arabesque in the web app world

    The arabesque specifications were written after the constitution of a collection of nearly 80 applications or webpages regarding relational data and allowing the visualization of spatial flow and network data.

    These applications are accessible from a dashboard (Le Campion, Nguyen, 2019) offering xxxxxx.

    A survey was also conducted in 2018 and 2019 on the uses and expectations of this type of cartographic application (Roelandt et. al, 2020).

    2.1. gflowiz’ corpus

    2.2. Arabesque presentation

    arabesque presents different possibilities for action on geographical information, statistics and cartographic aspects result from their intersection.

    ==> SEE SAGEO and translate ! 3 panneaux etc.

    Arabesque has filtering functionalities (numerical, categorical, temporal, spatial) with the possibility to define your own filters in addition to those automatically proposed.

    Numerical

    Geographical

    cartography and symbolisation

    Advanced graphical features are available for both nodes and links.

    3. Comparative analysis of arabesque vs other app’

    Selected comparable web application : keppler, magrit, flowmap.blue, cartoDB, mapBoxGL, Flourish …

    Justification of this selection is based on …

    ##. 3.4. Empirical validation

    Selected flowdataset

    Conclusion

    The developments currently in progress consist of refactoring the initial code, which has a twofold objective: to stabilise the application in its construction and in its operation and maintenance; to prepare a second version by adding additional functionalities or those identified as missing by the community.

    Fundings / financements : arabesque is developed within the framework of the project geographic flow visualisations (gflowiz) an interdisciplinary collaboration initiated to design and develop a new web application dedicated to the thematic geo-visualisation of flow and spatial network data.

    References (selected to be modified)
